title: Topic 001 Question 038
body: An application that is hosted on an Amazon EC2 instance needs access to files that are stored in an Amazon S3 bucket. The application lists the objects that are stored in the S3 bucket and displays a table to the user. During testing, a developer discovers that the application does not show any objects in the list.
What is the MOST secure way to resolve this issue?
options: Update the IAM instance profile that is attached to the EC2 instance to include the S3:* permission for the S3 bucket.
Update the IAM instance profile that is attached to the EC2 instance to include the S3:ListBucket permission for the S3 bucket.
Update the developer's user permissions to include the S3:ListBucket permission for the S3 bucket.
Update the S3 bucket policy by including the S3:ListBucket permission and by setting the Principal element to specify the account number of the EC2 instance.
